channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Government shutdown, CDC fight, Epstein probe, stock trading ban dominate agenda as Congress returns from recess
item.description: The most urgent task for Congress is to avoid a government shutdown on Sept. 30, when federal funding runs out.

item.title: Read This, Not That: Back-to-School Edition
item.description: NR writers propose alternatives to the usual fare found on schools’ required reading lists.

item.title: Lack of ‘civility’ is costing business $2 billion a day, according to the top HR research body. Here’s how to crack down on office rudeness, they say
item.description: SHRM's Jim Link told Fortune that companies should beware "Digital bravery," or saying whatever you want "from the safety and security of your screen....

item.title: A Decade After Merkel’s Refugee Gamble
item.description: The former German chancellor’s call to action reshaped Europe’s politics, and the crisis remains unresolved ten years later.

item.title: ‘Nonsensical’ illegal immigrant tuition policy scrapped in Kentucky, Bondi lawsuit deal
item.description: Kentucky becomes latest state to end in-state tuition for illegal immigrants following Justice Department legal action over federal law violations.

item.title: Insights from a 1949 Guide for Housewives
item.description: What could I learn from a book directed at ‘the newcomer to running a home’?

item.title: Trump nominees squeezed between 'blue slips' and blue obstruction
item.description: Senate Republicans defend blue slip tradition requiring home state approval for Trump's judicial and attorney nominees despite president's attacks.

item.title: Goodbye, August
item.description: At every age, I’ve tried to squeeze more and more out of Augusts that somehow seem to pass in a few flashes rather than languid weeks.

item.title: Trump says he will require voter ID with executive order
item.description: President Donald Trump says he will sign an executive order mandating voter ID and limiting mail-in voting, despite court ruling earlier this year.

item.title: The Ethos of the Left Is Fracturing Friendships
item.description: The postmodern left dissolves the individual into a soup of identities and communities, making sincere bonds harder to forge.

item.title: BofA’s president of Global Commercial Banking on best practices for securing the legacy of a multigen family business
item.description: In the U.S., some 32 million family-owned businesses contribute $7.7 trillion to GDP every year.

item.title: ‘Just another nail in the coffin for rural areas’: Affordable housing program faces the axe under Trump’s tax, budget cuts
item.description: The HOME program has helped build or repair over 1.3 million homes in the last 30 years, 540,000 of them in rural districts, the AP found.

item.title: Lee Corso Epitomizes The Spectacle Of Modern College Football
item.description: On Saturday, Lee Corso will make his final appearance on College GameDay , the ESPN show he has worked for since its inception in 1987.

item.description: The way the citizens of New Orleans united to restore their home and regain their destiny should serve as an inspiration to us all.
